channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-10600] HTable#batch() should perform validation on empty Put
item.description:
Raised by java8964 in this thread:
http://osdir.com/ml/general/2014-02/msg44384.html

When an empty Put is passed in the List to HTable#batch(), there is no validation performed whereas IllegalArgumentException would have been thrown if this empty Put in the simple Put API call.

Validation on empty Put should be carried out in HTable#batch().
item.summary: HTable#batch() should perform validation on empty Put

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Do you have a patch for this Ted?
Why would we allow an empty Put in the first place?

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12630817/10600-v2.txt
against trunk revision .

This message is automatically generated.

This change isn't good if the List<? extends Row> passed in is implemented with a linked list:


Index: hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/AsyncProcess.java

===================================================================

--- hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/AsyncProcess.java	(revision 1571444)

+++ hbase-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/client/AsyncProcess.java	(working copy)

@@ -479,7 +479,14 @@

     // The position will be used by the processBatch to match the object array returned.

     int posInList = -1;

     NonceGenerator ng = this.hConnection.getNonceGenerator();

-    for (Row r : rows) {

+    for (int i = 0; i < rows.size(); i++) {

+      Row r = rows.get(i);

+      if (r instanceof Put) {

+        Put put = (Put) r;

+        if (put.isEmpty()) {

+          throw new IllegalArgumentException("No columns to insert for #" + (i+1) + " item");

+        }

+      }

       posInList++;

       Action<Row> action = new Action<Row>(r, posInList);

       setNonce(ng, r, action);

I don't think we can assume to receive ArrayList because the type signature allows all list types. I haven't checked the JRE source but I'd guess that for example LinkedList#get(pos) will walk from the list head at each loop iteration.

Thanks for the review, Andy.

Indeed that is the case.
Will rewrite the loop in next patch.
Doesn't "posInList" count the same thing as "i", just with a 0-index instead?
